"My reverence is not reverence.
I'm afraid I'll humiliate our ancestors.'
He then paid homage and made one prostration.
The statue of the Way and the throne were shaken for a moment.
He paid another obeisance.
Both the image and the throne fell to the ground.
The body and throne were destroyed, and the people of the Dao were ashamed.
He called out, saying, "The wind drum will come in full force.
Again, he paid homage and fell back down.
Qiong said.
"The sky is bright and smooth, and we're talking about the wind of discontent.
Your foolishness doesn't allow you to fathom my wind.
The whole crowd was terrified and united in one heart to bow to Qiong.
When people from near and far heard about it, they abandoned the path and returned to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 闔境道俗及以傍縣道黨同嗟。
translation: The whole world, the Daoists, the laypeople, and the Daoists in nearby prefectures all shared their admiration.
They all came to ask Qiong to accept the bodhisattva precepts.
The magistrate, Gao, was very high.
He had always been sincere and respected his authority.
He even summoned monks to the temple in his state to disseminate the precepts.

source_sentence: 以貞觀八年終於所住(右一驗出唐高僧傳)。
translation: He ended up staying there in the eighth year of Zongguan (Right: A Record of Eminent Monks in Tang).
